Reason: The configuration option 'max_concurrent_automatic_sstable_upgrades' in the Cassandra project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. Increasing the maximum number of concurrent automatic sstable upgrades can lead to higher CPU and memory usage, potentially causing contention and slowdowns in the system. On the other hand, decreasing the value may result in slower data compaction and overall performance degradation. Therefore, any change in this configuration can have a noticeable effect on the system's execution time and resource consumption.
